body: @mowrang do you have a way to see the logs running behind the server? You should be able to see whats triggering this error

Hi @AdamBarnhard Here is the error log: 2020/02/27 18:20:57 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/model-versions/search [GET] Traceback (most recent call last): File ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/artifacts/list [GET] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2446, in hi @AdamBarnhard, 
Do have any clue based on the logs on how I should debug this? Any idea is appreciated as I am new to this and a bit lost. 
thanks!

Hi @AdamBarnhard, 

I am using mlflow version 1.6.0. which version of azure-storage have you tested this with? 

thanks, 

Maryam

@mowrang unfortunately, I haven't deployed MLflow on azure-storage so I can't provide much insight here. Please do keep this thread posted if you are able to develop a solution, Im sure it will be helpful to others. Have you tested pointing MLflow to local storage on the server you are running this on? To see if you can get that to work as a starting point?

For more logging, you can send gunicorn options through with `--gunicorn-opts`... for example, `--gunicorn-opts "--log-file -"`will send the logs to stderr. More gunicorn details [here](http://docs.gunicorn.org/en/0.17.0/configure.html#errorlog) and more mlflow details [here](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/cli.html#cmdoption-mlflow-server-gunicorn-opts)

thanks @AdamBarnhard 
you mean this? 
mlflow server --backend-store-uri /mlruns --default-artifact-root "$MLFLOW_SERVER_DEFAULT_ARTIFACT_ROOT" --host 0.0.0.0 --gunicorn-opts "--log-file -"

How should we list artifacts? that's the call that is failing. 
It is being called only with run_uuid

From your documentation it seems run_uuid is deprecated 

https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/rest-api.html#list-artifacts

but substituting it with run_id does not solve the issue. 

the documentation says that path is optional. Is that correct?

@AdamBarnhard  
These are the two requests that fail: 
[2020-03-05 23:16:06 +0000] [12] [ERROR] Error handling request /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/artifacts/list?run_uuid=cfa7e7632a0a4b7ab220f59e8aae97b0

[2020-03-05 23:16:07 +0000] [12] [ERROR] Error handling request /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/model-versions/search?filter=run_id%3D%27cfa7e7632a0a4b7ab220f59e8aae97b0%27
Can confirm this happens as well, logging is very sparse with nothing useful, all storage keys, etc have been crossed checked and functioning as intended.

Tracking flow server has 2 500 server errors when trying to access details on the experiment
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61163180/77572586-7b388580-6e8c-11ea-8c22-2ce5aad52546.png)

Pod logs indicate error in list_artifacts but when I extract the code and run it directly, I cant produce any error, the resources do exist.

```

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'search_model_versions'
```

Fixed on our side, looks like the issue possibly occured due to azure storage environment variable both being present even though one was blank at runtime.
AZURE_STORAGE_ACCESS_KEY
AZURE_STORAGE_CONNECTION_STRING
